intro: Trichanthecium pandum, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a dense cluster, and the leaves are narrow and slightly hairy. Trichanthecium pandum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
